codeSystems.name: AGREEIIDomains
codeSystems.title: AGREE II Domains
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem representing the domains assessed by the AGREE II instrument for evaluating the quality of clinical practice guidelines.

codeSystems.name: AMSTAR2ConfidenceRatings
codeSystems.title: AMSTAR 2 Overall Confidence Ratings
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem representing the overall confidence ratings from the AMSTAR 2 critical appraisal tool.

codeSystems.name: AWMFCS
codeSystems.title: awmf
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem representing different codes of interest for the Arbeitsgemeinschaft der Wissenschaftlichen Medizinischen Fachgesellschaften (AWMF)

codeSystems.name: AWMFGuidelineClass
codeSystems.title: AWMF Guideline Class
codeSystems.description:
As part of the project planning for the creation or updating of a guideline,
    a decision should be made at an early stage about the planned level classification ("S classification") according to the AWMF's system of rules (1-3).
    The S-classification scheme of the AWMF differentiates between the classes S1 treatment recommendation as well as S2e, S2k and S3 guideline.
    The "S" stands for the extent of the applied systematic approach in the development process of a guideline.
    Each class thus stands for a specific methodological concept that must be presented in a way that is comprehensible to the users.
    The choice of class is based on the question of how much effort is appropriate and feasible.
    The need for legitimacy for the implementation of the guideline (convincing the target group) must be taken into account.
    When choosing a higher S-classification in the context of updating a guideline, the adaptation to the corresponding methodology has to be considered.

codeSystems.name: AWMFGuidelineStatus
codeSystems.title: AWMF Guideline Status
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem representing the guideline status according to the AWMF.

codeSystems.title: Body System Conditions
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem representing various body system conditions.

codeSystems.name: CareSetting
codeSystems.title: Care Setting
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining different care settings, including levels of care, healthcare services, and treatment contexts.

codeSystems.name: ClinicalApplicationTypeCS
codeSystems.title: Clinical Application Type
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining different clinical application types

codeSystems.name: ContactPoint
codeSystems.title: Contact Point
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining types of contact points for a guideline

codeSystems.name: EvidenceRatingSystemCS
codeSystems.title: Evidence Rating System Code System
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem for identifying evidence rating and appraisal frameworks used in systematic reviews, guideline development, and clinical decision support.

codeSystems.name: EvidenceToDecisionCertaintyRating
codeSystems.title: Evidence To Decision Certainty Rating
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining GRADE Evidence to Decision (EtD) Framework Certainty Ratings

codeSystems.name: EvidenceToDecisionCertaintyType
codeSystems.title: Evidence To Decision Certainty type
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining values to represent the GRADE Evidence to Decision (EtD) Framework Certainty Type

codeSystems.name: GuidelineAuthorRoleCS
codeSystems.title: Guideline Author Role
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining roles for the author of the guideline.

codeSystems.name: GuidelineReleaseType
codeSystems.title: Guideline Release Type
codeSystems.description: CodeSystem defining different guideline release types

codeSystems.name: GuidelineSections
codeSystems.title: Guideline Sections
codeSystems.description: Sections of a guideline, describing various aspects such as its intention, target patient group, care setting, and other relevant contextual information.

codeSystems.title: Intended Audience Code System
